subtitle: Try sandwiching two cookies together with a little butter icing.

method.text: Beat the butter until soft. Sieve together the icing sugar, flour, cinnamon and cornflour. Add to the butter with the salt and essence. Mix until well incorporated and a smooth dough is formed.
Spoon the mixture into a piping bag fitted with a large star nozzle. Pipe small shapes, spaced well apart, onto ungreased baking trays. Dredge with a little sifted cocoa powder.
Bake in oven for 12-14 min until firm and golden. Allow to cool slightly. Then transfer to a wire rack with a palette knife to become crisp and cool completely.
